transcript:
face, and it took on the unattractive martyrlike expression it so often wore, as she submitted herself to Mademoiselle Bourienne and Lise. Both these women quite sincerely tried to make her look pretty. She was so plain that neither of them could think of her as a rival, so they began dressing her with perfect sincerity, and with 
the naive and firm conviction women have that dress can make a face pretty. 
"No really, my dear, this dress is not pretty," said Lise, looking sideways at Princess
